assessment_structure.description: Assessment follows CureFun paper methodology with Aspects (proactive inquiry) and Information (key data elicited)

aspects.description: Items that require proactive inquiry by the student (30% of total score)

items.name: Onset and Timeline Inquiry
items.description: Did the student ask when symptoms started and how they progressed over time?

items.name: Severity Assessment
items.description: Did the student inquire about symptom severity and impact on daily functioning?

items.name: Previous Treatment History
items.description: Did the student ask about previous psychiatric treatment, therapy, or medications?

items.name: Suicide Risk Assessment
items.description: Did the student directly and sensitively assess suicidal ideation, plan, and intent?

items.name: Substance Use Inquiry
items.description: Did the student ask about alcohol, drug use, and smoking habits?

items.name: Family Psychiatric History
items.description: Did the student inquire about family history of mental illness?

items.name: Social Support Assessment
items.description: Did the student ask about relationships, living situation, and social support?

items.name: Sleep and Appetite Patterns
items.description: Did the student inquire about sleep quality, duration, and appetite changes?

information.description: Key information that must be elicited from patient (70% of total score)

items.name: Primary Symptoms
items.description: Core psychiatric symptoms present in the case

items.name: Duration and Frequency
items.description: How long symptoms have been present and how often they occur

items.name: Functional Impairment
items.description: Impact on work, relationships, and daily activities

items.name: Safety Information
items.description: Suicidal/homicidal thoughts, specific plans, protective factors

items.name: Substance Details
items.description: Specific substances, amounts, frequency, and duration of use

items.name: Relevant Medical Information
items.description: Medical conditions, medications, allergies relevant to psychiatric presentation

items.name: Psychosocial Stressors
items.description: Recent life events, trauma, losses, or stressors triggering symptoms

non_scoring_metrics.description: Reference metrics that provide additional context but don't affect score

metrics.name: Information Density
metrics.description: Density of medical entities and relevant information in dialogue

metrics.name: Emotional Tendency
metrics.description: Emotional polarity and friendliness in student's communication

metrics.name: Response Length
metrics.description: Average length of student responses in tokens

metrics.name: Rapport Quality
metrics.description: Quality of therapeutic alliance and patient comfort level

aspects.description: Score based on whether the student asked about the aspect

scale.2: Thoroughly explored with appropriate follow-up questions
scale.1: Asked about but not fully explored

information.description: Score based on whether key information was successfully elicited

scale.2: Information fully elicited with appropriate detail
scale.1: Information partially elicited or lacking detail
scale.0: Information not elicited or obtained inappropriately

interpretation.5-6: Satisfactory - Basic skills but needs improvement
interpretation.3-4: Needs Improvement - Significant gaps in assessment
interpretation.0-2: Poor - Unsafe or inadequate psychiatric assessment
